liability.name: Limitation of Liability
liability.description: Standard limitation of liability clause with variations

variations.name: Standard
variations.text: IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SERVICE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THE TOTAL LIABILITY OF EITHER PARTY FOR ANY CLAIM ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT SHALL NOT EXCEED THE AMOUNTS PAID BY CUSTOMER IN THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS PRECEDING THE INCIDENT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM.

variations.name: High Risk
variations.text: TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY'S TOTAL AGGREGATE LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT EXCEED THE GREATER OF (A) FIVE MILLION DOLLARS ($5,000,000) OR (B) TWO TIMES (2X) THE TOTAL AMOUNT PAID OR PAYABLE BY CUSTOMER IN THE TWELVE (12) MONTH PERIOD IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE INCIDENT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM.
exceptions: Death or personal injury caused by negligence
Any other liability that cannot be excluded by law

variations.name: Standard Software
variations.text: PROVIDER WARRANTS THAT THE SERVICES WILL PERFORM MATERIALLY IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOCUMENTATION FOR A PERIOD OF NINETY (90) DAYS FROM THE DATE OF DELIVERY. IF THE SERVICES DO NOT CONFORM TO THE WARRANTY, PROVIDER WILL USE COMMERCIALLY REASONABLE EFFORTS TO CORRECT THE NONCONFORMITY. THIS WARRANTY IS EXCLUSIVE AND IN LIEU OF ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, WHETHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND NON-INFRINGEMENT.
exceptions: Use not in accordance with documentation

variations.name: Hardware Specific
variations.text: PROVIDER WARRANTS THAT THE HARDWARE WILL BE FREE FROM DEFECTS IN MATERIALS AND WORKMANSHIP UNDER NORMAL USE FOR A PERIOD OF ONE (1) YEAR FROM THE DATE OF DELIVERY. CUSTOMER'S SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY FOR BREACH OF THIS WARRANTY SHALL BE REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF THE DEFECTIVE HARDWARE, AT PROVIDER'S OPTION AND EXPENSE.

variations.name: Standard Two-Way
variations.text: Each party agrees to maintain the confidentiality of the other party's Confidential Information with at least the same degree of care it uses to protect its own confidential information, but in no event less than reasonable care. Neither party shall disclose or use the other party's Confidential Information except as necessary to perform its obligations or exercise its rights under this Agreement. This obligation shall survive the termination of this Agreement for a period of five (5) years.
exceptions: Information required by law to be disclosed

variations.name: High Security
variations.text: Each party shall protect the other party's Confidential Information using encryption standards no less than AES-256 for data at rest and TLS 1.3 for data in transit. Physical copies must be stored in locked facilities with access restricted to named individuals who have executed individual non-disclosure agreements. This obligation shall survive indefinitely following the termination of this Agreement.
exceptions: Court order with prior notice to disclosing party

variations.name: Standard
variations.text: Either party may terminate this Agreement: (a) upon thirty (30) days prior written notice to the other party for any reason; or (b) immediately upon written notice if the other party materially breaches any term of this Agreement and fails to cure such breach within thirty (30) days after receiving written notice thereof. Upon termination, Customer shall immediately cease all use of the Services and pay all outstanding fees.

variations.name: Enterprise
variations.text: Either party may terminate this Agreement: (a) upon ninety (90) days prior written notice to the other party for any reason; or (b) immediately upon written notice for material breach. Upon termination, Provider shall assist in the orderly transition of services to Customer or its designated provider for a period not to exceed six (6) months, at Provider's then-current professional services rates.

variations.name: Standard
variations.text: Neither party shall be liable for any failure or delay in performance under this Agreement due to circumstances beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to acts of God, war, terrorism, pandemic, natural disasters, governmental actions, or telecommunications failures. The affected party shall promptly notify the other party of the force majeure event and use reasonable efforts to resume performance as soon as possible.

variations.name: Strict
variations.text: Force majeure events must: (1) be beyond the reasonable control of the affected party; (2) not have been reasonably foreseeable at the time of entering into this Agreement; and (3) not be capable of being mitigated through the implementation of business continuity measures. The affected party must provide written notice within 24 hours of the event and daily status updates thereafter.
